dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 3025 IH: Expanding Access to Fertility Care for Servicemembers and Dependents Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Strickland (for herself, Ms. Norton, Mr. Takano, and Ms. Pressley) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to provide for the coverage of assisted reproductive services under the TRICARE program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Expanding Access to Fertility Care for Servicemembers and Dependents Act.

section.header: Coverage of assisted reproductive services under TRICARE program
section.text: Chapter 55 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 1074o the following new section:

section.header: Assisted reproductive services for certain members and dependents

subsection.text: Any member of the armed forces (including the reserve components) performing active service who is entitled to medical care under the TRICARE program, and any dependent of such a member, shall be entitled to assisted reproductive services as part of such medical care, without regard to any of the following:

paragraph.text: Whether the assisted reproductive service is related to the treatment of a service-connected disability.
Whether the member has a serious illness or injury resulting from a service-connected disability.
The ability of the member or dependent, as applicableâ€”

subparagraph.text: to conceive a pregnancy or carry a pregnancy to live birth after an appropriate period of regular, unprotected sexual intercourse; or
to reproduce, either as an individual or with a partner.

paragraph.text: The sex, gender, sexual orientation, or marital status of the member or dependent, as applicable.

The term appropriate period means, with respect to an individual, a period of at least one year, unless the health care provider of the individual determines, based on medical history, age, or physical findings, that a shorter period is appropriate.
The term assisted reproductive services includes the following services:

subparagraph.text: Assisted reproduction, including intravaginal insemination, intracervical insemination, and intrauterine insemination.
The preservation of embryos, eggs, or sperm through cryopreservation.
Such other forms of assisted reproductive services as determined appropriate by the Secretary.
